content.description:
WATER BROTHERS 5.10b ** (70') M(3b)

Beginning at the short seam climb the left edge of the face  of Grok Rock to the diagonal finger crack and chain anchors on top. Bring a full range of cams. Great face and crack climbing.
content.protection: mixed - 3 bolts plus a full range of cams
content.location: the left edge of Grok Rock

content.description:
REAPER MADNESS 5.11c **** (80') M (7b)

An excellent direct start variation of "The Grin Reaper", taking a steep line directly below the upper face. Small and medium cams are needed for the lower crack. A good rest divides the lower strenuous crack and the thin upper face (rap bolt anchors just below the top) - super sustained climb!
content.protection: Mixed 7 bolts, plus small to medium cams for the lower half.
content.location: Belay along the side of the road and climb the wall left of the corner.

content.description:
Little Minnows 5.6 (70') G

The cracks and arete right of the big overhang to the cold shut anchors on the arete above.
content.location: Begin at the left side of the smooth blank marbled slab

content.description:
THE LEFT HAND OF DARKNESS 5.10b ** (85') M(4b)

The left facing crack 20' right of the "Reaper" face. Begin in the mossy corner behind the small maple and ascend the arching corner to its end (5.9), continue up the bolted face above (tricky!) and step left to the rap anchors. Excellent climbing; well protected with big rests.
content.protection: mixed, 4 bolts up high, small to medium gear down low.
content.location: The left facing crack 20' right of the "Reaper" face.

content.description:
GROK THIS! 5.11d *** (65') F(7b)

Takes a direct line up the middle of "Grok Rock" a small detached face about 150' east of the main Riverside cliff. Begin at the curiously hollow face, make a stick clip or boulder the first moves, traverse up and right  to the thin crack/seam. Follow this to the chain anchors on top.
content.location: Up the middle of Grok Rock the small cliff east of the main Riverside cliffs.

content.description:
THE GRIN REAPER 5.11b *** (85') M(4b)

A great climb! Begin in the left-facing corner formed by the huge flake, climb this (5.10+) to the sharp hand traverse right and then on up the dark bolted face above. Sustained, various and progressively harder cruxes with good rests and pro make a fun (if scary) challenge. A #0 TCU and #1 Camalot are nice on the traverse. Beware of rope drag....
content.protection: Mixed, 4 bolts up high, a range of cams down low.
content.location: Begin in the left-facing corner formed by the huge flake,

content.description:
COUGAR CORNER 5.8 * (75') G

The blocky crack/shallow chimney at the left side of the crag with the runout upper face topping out at the big fir tree.
content.location: At the far left end of the crag
